item.title: This Vibrantly Green Rice Is Also a Feast for the Eyes
item.description: Rich with kale and halloumi, this elegant rice dish is special enough for just about any occasion.

item.title: I Co-Parent My Kids. Would It Be Wrong to Move Abroad?
item.description: How should I weigh my children’s emotional needs against my own need for healing, belonging and growth?

item.title: In the Trump Presidency, the Rules Are Vague. That Might Be the Point.
item.description: The U.S. has long believed that unspecific laws threaten democracy. So why is the administration being so vague?

item.title: What’s More Famous: ‘Jaws’ or ‘The Godfather’?
item.description: A ruling on the most subjective and inane dispute of all time.

item.title: Jennifer Lawrence Regrets Everything She’s Ever Said or Done
item.description: At only 35, the actress has been through the celebrity wringer. Here’s where she landed.

item.title: The Weeknight-Friendly Dish That’s Good With Just About Anything
item.description: Mushy peas, a British classic, are perhaps the ultimate easy side.

item.title: Should I Warn Home Buyers About the Wailing Neighbor?
item.description: I don’t want to prevent a current neighbor from selling, but it feels as if disclosure should take place.

item.title: Is a Really Big Half-Sandwich Technically a Whole Sandwich?
item.description: A ruling on a serving-size dispute.

item.title: Fox News Wanted Greg Gutfeld to Do This Interview. He Wasn’t So Sure.
item.description: The pugnacious conservative late-night host on his “hierarchy of smears” and the risks of being a scold.

item.title: After 35 Years, Do I Still Have to Cook for My Husband?
item.description: I simply am not interested in food labor for another 25 years.

item.title: She Was Ready to Have Her 15th Child. Then Came the Felony Charges.
item.description: MaryBeth Lewis’s desire to be a new mom again, at 65 years old, led to a custody battle like no other.

item.title: Why Does So Much New Technology Feel Inspired by Dystopian Sci-Fi Movies?
item.description: The industry keeps echoing ideas from bleak satires and cyberpunk stories as if they were exciting possibilities, not grim warnings.

item.title: A Harrowing Escape From the Drone-Infested Hellscape of Ukraine’s Front Lines
item.description: In Ukraine, unmanned weapons hunt the wounded and medics alike. Moving injured soldiers to safety has never been more difficult.

item.title: They Fell in Love With A.I. Chatbots — and Found Something Real
item.description: Three people on the joys and anxieties of A.I. romances.
